com.github.aruberto.businesstime.jdk8

Class BusinessDateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.aruberto.businesstime.jdk8.BusinessDateTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.time.chrono.ChronoZonedDateTime<?>>, java.time.chrono.ChronoZonedDateTime<java.time.LocalDate>, java.time.temporal.Temporal, java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor

    public final class BusinessDateTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.time.temporal.Temporal, java.time.chrono.ChronoZonedDateTime<java.time.LocalDate>, java.io.Serializable
    BusinessDateTime is an unmodifiable datetime class representing a datetime.

    BusinessDateTime represents an exact point on the time-line, where time-line:

    • is limited to the precision of nanoseconds
    • only includes points that fall between start and end of business day
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BusinessDateTime()
      Constructs an instance of BusinessDateTime at current time in system time zone, with business day starting at 9am, business day ending at 5pm, no holidays and working week of Monday to Friday
      BusinessDateTime(java.time.LocalTime dayStartTime, java.time.LocalTime dayEndTime)
      Constructs an instance of BusinessDateTime at current time in system time zone with business day starting at dayStartTime, business day ending at dayEndTime, no holidays and working week of Monday to Friday

      Constructs an instance of BusinessDateTime at current time in system time zone with business day starting at dayStartTime, business day ending at dayEndTime, holiday list of holidays and working week of Monday to Friday

    • Constructor Detail

      • BusinessDateTime

        public BusinessDateTime(java.time.ZonedDateTime dateTime,
                        java.time.LocalTime dayStartTime,
                        java.time.LocalTime dayEndTime,
                        java.util.Set<java.time.LocalDate> holidays,
                        net.objectlab.kit.datecalc.common.WorkingWeek workingWeek)
        Constructs an instance of BusinessDateTime at point of time of dateTime with business day starting at dayStartTime, business day ending at dayEndTime, holiday list of holidays and working week of workingWeek
        Parameters:
        dateTime - date time, null means current time with default time zone
        dayStartTime - business day start time, null means 9am
        dayEndTime - business day end time, null means 5pm
        holidays - holidays, null means no holidays
        workingWeek - the working week, null means Monday to Friday
